comments:
EMF test resources are corrupted when applying an Eclipse patch.

When an EMF test resource is contained in an Eclipse patch file (e.g. <right 
click a node in the Package Explorer> >> Team >> Create Patch...), upon 
applying the Eclipse patch file, the EMF test resources are corrupted.  For 
example, patching an test suite causes the below exception when opening the 
test suite after applying the patch:

When attempting to open the compressed EMF test resource (e.g. WinZip on 
Windows), the following error is generated:

Extracting to "C:\Documents and Settings\chng1me.T40-92U-V46\Local 
Settings\Temp\"
Use Path: no   Overlay Files: yes
warning [D:\Workspaces\workspace_TPTP\test-
results\platform\org.eclipse.hyades.use.cases\manual\Profiling_and_Logging\Platf
orm.Communication.Installation_Uninstallation.Linux_zSeries.testsuite]:  extra 
3 bytes at beginning or within Zip file (attempting to process anyway)
For file "ResourceContents", the time stamp in the central directory is 
invalid, using the current system time instead.
Error in file #1:  bad Zip file offset (Error local header signature not 
found):  0
(attempting to re-compensate)
For file "ResourceContents", the time stamp in the local directory is invalid, 
using the current system time instead.
Extracting ResourceContents
Error:  invalid compressed data to inflate
Please can you zip and attach the patch here.

I've tested and as I suspected the patch support from Eclipse doesn't work with
binary files.

Binary files (e.g. compressed EMF test resources) cannot be patched by the CVS 
server.  The Eclipse Team support Team is looking at several solution to this 
issue.  We should keep this defect open to respond (e.g. code/documentation) to 
the solution provided by the Eclipse Team support Team.  Also, we should 
document that patching compressed EMF test resources is not supported at this 
time.  As such, decreasing the severity.

I'm still not sure why do you want to track this problem here, Team -> Apply
Patch is not a TPTP feature.

(In reply to comment #5)

Although the Eclipse Team support is not part of the TPTP project, users of 
TPTP Test (including TPTP committers) do attempt to create patches that include 
binary files, such as compressed EMF test resources, since Team support is 
provided in several TPTP views (e.g. Test Navigator).  This defect is to track 
and react to the outcome of #67306 and for documentation purposes.

I agree with Marius. I don't think we should keep this defect opened just to 
track a generic CVS issue we have no control over

(In reply to comment #7)

I have no problem with returning this defect as a duplicate of 67306 or closing 
this defect.  However, I still feel we should document this limitation in TPTP 
since users do attempt to create patches that include binary files, such as 
compressed EMF test resources, since Team support is provided in several TPTP 
views (e.g. Test Navigator).

We do need to track our dependancies.
This defect should nto close unless we intend this to be a permanent 
restriction and not something TPTP cares about.
If it is dupped against a platform defect, the platform defect needs the 
correct severity, and needs to be followed.

If we keep this floating open we will at least keep an eye on it.

This will not get fixed in 4.1 but Marius please persue this for 4.2
Ruth, this is a model defect
